intro: Mammillaria geminata subsp. nejapensis, commonly known as the Nejapén mammillaria, is a small cactus native to Mexico. It features a compact, globular stem with white to pale blue spines and a dense covering of fine, white hairs. The plant produces yellow flowers during the spring and summer months. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires minimal water, making it suitable for arid environments. Due to its delicate structure, it is often cultivated as a prized ornamental cactus.
